title: 107_hr3898
content: The Act titled "Capital Construction Fund Qualified Withdrawal Act of 2002" encourages the retirement of certain fishing vessels and permits under the Merchant Marine Act of 1936. The Merchant Marine Act of 1936 is amended to allow modifications to agreements for the sustainability of US fisheries by making the termination of a capital construction fund a qualified withdrawal in exchange for retiring related fishing vessels and permits. Amendments are made to allow new qualified withdrawals under the Act. The Merchant Marine Act of 1936 is amended to allow modifications to agreements for the sustainability of US fisheries by making the termination of a capital construction fund a qualified withdrawal in exchange for retiring related fishing vessels and permits. Amendments include the payment of an industry fee authorized by the fishing capacity reduction program and rollover contributions for shareholders. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows for qualified withdrawals from individual retirement plans or capital construction funds for retiring fishing vessels and permits. The Secretary of Commerce will establish procedures to ensure the retirement of related commercial fishing assets. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include the payment of an industry fee for fishing capacity reduction programs under the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow rollover contributions to individual retirement plans and payments for retiring commercial fishing vessels and permits. The Secretary of the Treasury will establish procedures to ensure retirement of vessels and permits after a qualified withdrawal. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows rollover contributions to individual retirement plans and payments for retiring fishing vessels and commercial fishery permits. The amendments made by this Act will apply to withdrawals made after the enactment date.
